snippet: A Duke neuroscientist says he has connected the brains of two rats in such a way that when one moves to press a lever, the other one does, too — most of the time.
abstract: Study published in journal Scientific Reports documents experiment in which brains of two rats were connected in such a way that when one rat moves to press lever, the other one does, too; it is first time that one animal's brain had been linked to another.
lead_paragraph: A Duke neuroscientist says he has connected the brains of two rats in such a way that when one moves to press a lever, the other one does, too — most of the time.

headline.seo: New Research Suggests Two Rat Brains Can Be Linked
headline.main: In a First, Experiment Links Brains of Two Rats
